hedline.hl1: Where the Diners Must Choose Sides

abstract.p: Saladang Song, new restaurant in Pasadena, Calif, has a fusion menu and design that fuses Thai and Southern Californian methods and motifs; photo (S)

block.p: What's better than one Thai restaurant? Two. Wallaporn Vattanatham, who is known as Dang, owns Sal adang, a popular Thai restaurant in Pasadena. When she opened another restaurant across the street, she went for a fusion menu, and surroundings to reflect two cultures. Saladang Song (loosely, Dang's Retreat II) is by Tolkin & Byram & Associates, an architectural firm. It fuses Thai and Southern California methods and motifs and has an open courtyard, top, with walls, above, that are 22 feet high and are made of alternating concrete panels and laser-cut screens patterned like ancient Thai fabrics. 383 South Fair Oaks Avenue; (626) 793-5200.
